p.codeblock: abstract preloadSrc(src: string, startPos: number): number;
abstract preloadSrc(src: string, startPos: number): number;
Future<void> preloadSrc({required String src, required int startPos});
public abstract int PreloadSrc(string src, Int64 startPos);

section.p: You can call this method to preload a media resource into the playlist. To preload multiple media resources, call this method multiple times. After calling this method, if you receive the callback with event PlayerPreloadEventComplete, the preload is successful; if you receive the callback with event PlayerPreloadEventError, the preload has failed. After successful preload, call to play the media resource, or call to clear the playlist.

You can call this method to preload a media resource into the playlist. To preload multiple media resources, call this method multiple times. After calling this method, if you receive the callback with PlayerPreloadEventComplete, the preload is successful. If you receive PlayerPreloadEventError, the preload has failed. After a successful preload, call to play the media resource, or to clear the playlist.

You can call this method to preload a media resource into the playlist. To preload multiple media resources, call this method multiple times. After preloading succeeds, call to play the media resource, or call to clear the playlist.

You can call this method to preload a media resource into the playlist. To preload multiple media resources, call this method multiple times. After successful preloading, call to play the media resource, or call to clear the playlist.

ul.li: Before calling this method, make sure you have successfully opened the media resource using or .
The SDK does not support preloading duplicate media resources into the playlist, but it does support preloading the currently playing media resource again into the playlist.
Before calling this method, make sure you have successfully opened the media resource using or .
The SDK does not support preloading duplicate media resources into the playlist, but it does support preloading a media resource that is currently playing.
Before calling this method, make sure you have successfully called or to open the media resource.
The SDK does not support preloading duplicate media resources into the playlist, but supports preloading the currently playing media resource again into the playlist.
Before calling this method, make sure you have successfully opened the media resource using or .
The SDK does not support preloading duplicate media resources into the playlist, but it does support preloading the currently playing media resource again into the playlist.

plentry.pd: The network path of the media resource.
The starting position (in milliseconds) when playback begins after preloading into the playlist. For live streams, set this parameter to 0.
The network path of the media resource.
The starting position (in milliseconds) when playback begins after preloading into the playlist. Set this parameter to 0 when preloading a live stream.
Network path of the media resource.
Start position (in milliseconds) when playback begins after preloading into the playlist. Set to 0 when preloading a live stream.
The network path of the media resource.
The start position (in milliseconds) for playback after preloading into the playlist. Set this parameter to 0 when preloading a live stream.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: Failure. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
